about_the_game:
What is the iVRy PSMoveServiceEx Tracker for SteamVR DLC?


• It is a version of the PSMoveServiceEx software that has been customised to simplify installation and configuration for use with the iVRy Driver for SteamVR.

What is PSMoveServiceEx?


• PSMoveServiceEx is a background service that manages multiple PSMove Controllers and PS3 Eye Cameras. Clients connect to the service and stream PSMove Controller state (position, orientation and button presses). A visual client front-end is used for controller/tracker configuration.

Where can I find the source code of the Open Source PSMoveServiceEx component?


• The source repository is hosted on GitHub under the name "PSMoveServiceEx".

• The PSMoveServiceEx binaries are unmodified from the latest GitHub repository release.

What does that mean?

• Want to use your Sony Playstation Move controllers to play PC VR* (Virtual Reality) titles?

• Want to add 6DOF (orientation & positional) tracking** to your iVRy VR headset?

• With iVRy, the PSMoveServiceEx Tracker for SteamVR and 2 or more Sony Playstation Eye cameras you can!

* Valve OpenVR/SteamVR. Requires Valve Steam & SteamVR on Windows 7 or later.
** Requires LED ball or additional PS Move controller (see "Virtual HMD" section of PSMoveService Wiki, ignore "Additional Software" section)
detailed_description:
Before you start

IMPORTANT:

Before using PSMoveServiceEx for the first time, you will need to follow the instructions in the "Initial Setup Documentation" section of the PSMoveService Wiki (View the manual).

It is recommended to use the "IPISoft PS3EYEDriver" driver for the Sony Playstation Eye camera (link given in "PSEye Software Setup" section of the PSMoveService Wiki).

You can launch the "PSMoveConfigTool" described in the Wiki by selecting the "Configure PSMoveService" option from the iVRy "Launch" button. PSMoveService will be started automatically.

NOTE:

PSMoveServiceEx is experimental software. It is provided in DLC form as a convenience for those users who wish to experiment with it. It is complicated to set up, not suitable for all purposes, with no guarantee of success. If you are not comfortable with experimental software, that requires a lot of tweaking, and may not be suitable for your purposes, then please do not use it. It is not, under any circumstances, to be considered as "production level quality" software. It is open-source software, made by volunteers, in their free time.
